qas.question: What section of the Sahara's cloud cover are the most   accentuated?

context: <b8_0>The rainfall inhibition and the dissipation of cloud cover<b8_0/> are most accentuated over the <a0_0><b3_0>eastern<a0_0/> section<b3_0/> of the Sahara rather than the western. The prevailing air mass lying above the Sahara is the <b4_0>continental tropical<b4_0/> (cT) air mass which is <a1_0>hot and dry<a1_0/>. <b5_0>Hot, dry air<b5_0/> masses primarily form over the <a2_0>North-African desert<a2_0/> from the heating of the vast continental land area, and it affects the whole desert during most of the year. Because of this extreme heating process, <b12_0>a <b6_0><b7_0>thermal<b7_0/><b6_0/> low<b12_0/> is usually noticed near the surface, and is the strongest and the most developed <b9_0>during the summertime<b9_0/>. The Sahara High represents the eastern continental extension of <b10_0>the Azores High<b10_0/>, centered over the North Atlantic Ocean. The subsidence of the Sahara High nearly reaches the ground <b11_0>during the coolest part of the year<b11_0/> while it limits to the upper troposphere during the hottest periods.
